intro: Trymalium spathulatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf trymalium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. It produces small, clustered flowers that are often pink or purple in color. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
